attributes.action: Set up a Public Inquiry as to why a SUPERMAJORITY was not set for EU Referendum
attributes.additional_details:
David Lidington rejected a super-majority because the referendum was only ADVISORY (Confirmed by the Supreme Court and in Briefing Paper on the Bill)

The status of the referendum is further called into question by the facts set out in the attached letter

The government does not have a mandate to do the destructive things it is now doing to the UK

It's reputation, it's currency and it's economy have all been trashed.

https://t.co/XcXqHrYhoD

https://t.co/amQeL6QRjX

https://t.co/M7XMFbFrMt
attributes.background:
For Constitutional change, the EU referendum SHOULD have had a super-majority and a devolution lock

At what point did the advisory referendum become mandatory without them?

We want an answer to these points which are also raised in the attached letter to Michael Gove which never got a response

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
                
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
